summary: This bill, the DHS Suicide Prevention and Resiliency for Law Enforcement Act, aims to establish a comprehensive Law Enforcement Mental Health and Wellness Program within the Department of Homeland Security. The program will focus on data collection, research, training, and partnerships to address the mental health and well-being of law enforcement officers and agents. It mandates the Secretary to establish policies, conduct surveys, and report on suicide incidents, while also promoting cultural shifts to reduce stigma associated with seeking mental health assistance. The bill emphasizes confidentiality and voluntary participation, and requires briefings to congressional committees.
